holidays.name: International Women's Day
holidays.description: A global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural, and political achievements of women, while also advocating for gender equality.
holidays.origin: Started in the early 1900s amid labor movements in North America and Europe; officially recognized by the UN in 1977.
holidays.funFact: The first official International Women's Day was celebrated on March 19, 1911, but the date shifted to March 8 shortly after and has remained ever since.

holidays.name: World Kidney Day
holidays.description: An awareness day dedicated to raising awareness of the importance of our kidneys and reducing the frequency and impact of kidney disease.
holidays.origin: Launched in 2006 by the International Society of Nephrology and International Federation of Kidney Foundations.
holidays.funFact: Kidneys filter around 50 gallons (190 liters) of blood every single day‚Äîeven though each kidney only the size of a fist!

holidays.name: Proofreading Day
holidays.description: A lighthearted nod to the unsung heroes who catch typos, grammar gaffes, and spelling mistakes before text goes public.
holidays.origin: Started in the early 2000s by editorial enthusiasts to raise awareness of the importance of proofreading in publishing.
holidays.funFact: Proofreading Day is celebrated on March 8 because '3/8' looks like a backwards 'pa' ‚Äî short for 'proofreaders' appreciation'.
